intro: Ponthieva parvula, commonly known as the small-leaved ponthieva, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. Its flowers are small and clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, which is typically enclosed by a modified leaf known as a spathe. Ponthieva parvula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in moist environments.
